poem:
"Ode to Iron Lace"

In defiance of gravity, she rises,
A needlework of iron, tattered by time.
Unseen fingers of the workers whisper along her veins,
Pacifying the cadaverous hue of decay.

Silent protest silenced, yet echoes
In the vertiginous vault of Parisian sky.
Her bones creaking tales of forgotten labor,
Moulded by men, claimed by rust.

Endurance etched in the pallor of aged steel,
In iron we trust, in rust we feel.
